TriTrypDB is an integrated genomic and functional genomic database for pathogens of the family Trypanosomatidae, including organisms in both Leishmania and Trypanosoma genera. TriTrypDB and its continued development are possible through the collaborative efforts between EuPathDB, GeneDB and colleagues at the Seattle Biomedical Research Institute (SBRI).

For a list of the data integrated into TriTrypDB and the related publications please see Data Sets.

Please check our annual EuPathDB Workshop at UGA exercises to see the scope of data and functionality in our sites.

Much of the data in TriTrypDB is provided by independent researchers. For a list of the data integrated into TriTrypDB and the related publications see Data Sets. Please cite the authors/providers when you use their data.

Each project in EuPathDB benefits from the advice and mentoring of people from each specific community.

The Eukaryotic Pathogen Database (EuPathDB) has been developed as a Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC), with support from the US National Institutes of Health (NIH). TriTrypDB joins the family of pathogen-databases that are housed under the NIAID-funded EuPathDB Bioinformatics Resource Center (BRC) umbrella. Additional funding for a kinetoplastid component (TriTrypDB) was originally provided by the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation and has since been funded via successive awards from The Wellcome Trust. The EuPathDB team is mainly distributed between the University of Pennsylvania Philadelphia, USA the University of Georgia, Georgia, USA, and with several members of the team located at the University of Liverpool, United Kingdom, University of Glasgow, United Kingdom and The Wellcome Trust Sanger Institute, United Kingdom.

The data at this site is provided freely for public use, through the contributions of many researchers including those involved in generating the genome sequences. The data is not guaranteed to be accurate as it often reflects the results of ongoing research. When using data obtained from any EuPathDB project, it is important to cite the original publications and contributors of that data.
Please see Citing TriTrypDB below.

We do not use or share any of your personal information for any purpose unrelated to the functionality of the websites; however, we do collect some information to help us understand how our sites are being used and to improve community support. See the Website Privacy Policy for details.

When citing TriTrypDB itself, please use:

TriTrypDB: a functional genomic resource for the Trypanosomatidae
2010 Nucleic Acids Research 38(Database issue):D457-D462; doi:10.1093/nar/gkp851
[ Full text ]

When citing EuPathDB itself, please use:
EuPathDB: the eukaryotic pathogen genomics database resource.
2017 Nucleic Acids Res. Jan 4;45(D1):D581-D591. doi: 10.1093/nar/gkw1105
[ Full text ]

Much of the data in TriTrypDB is provided by independent researchers. Please cite them if you use their data. For a list of the data integrated into TriTrypDB and the related publications please see Data Sets.
